The Ten Curtains for the Tabernacle (Exodus 26:1–6)

\w All|strong="H3605"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w skilled|strong="H2450"\w* craftsmen among \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w workmen|strong="H4399"\w* \w made|strong="H6213"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w ten|strong="H6235"\w* \w curtains|strong="H3407"\w* \w for|strong="H6213"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w tabernacle|strong="H4908"\w*. \w They|strong="H6213"\w* \w were|strong="H3742"\w* \w made|strong="H6213"\w* \w of|strong="H3820"\w* \w finely|strong="H8336"\w* spun \w linen|strong="H8336"\w*, \w as|strong="H2803"\w* \w well|strong="H3820"\w* \w as|strong="H2803"\w* \w blue|strong="H8504"\w*, \w purple|strong="H8504"\w*, \w and|strong="H8504"\w* \w scarlet|strong="H8144"\w* \w yarn|strong="H8144"\w*, \w with|strong="H6213"\w* \w cherubim|strong="H3742"\w* skillfully \w worked|strong="H6213"\w* \w into|strong="H6213"\w* \w them|strong="H6213"\w*.

The Eleven Curtains of Goat Hair (Exodus 26:7–14)

\w He|strong="H6213"\w* \w then|strong="H6213"\w* \w made|strong="H6213"\w* \w curtains|strong="H3407"\w* \w of|strong="H5921"\w* \w goat|strong="H5795"\w* hair \w for|strong="H5921"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w tent|strong="H3407"\w* \w over|strong="H5921"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w tabernacle|strong="H4908"\w*—\w eleven|strong="H6249"\w* \w curtains|strong="H3407"\w* \w in|strong="H5921"\w* \w all|strong="H6213"\w*.

Additionally, \w he|strong="H6213"\w* \w made|strong="H6213"\w* \w for|strong="H6213"\w* \w the|strong="H6213"\w* tent \w a|strong="H3068"\w* \w covering|strong="H4372"\w* \w of|strong="H4372"\w* ram \w skins|strong="H5785"\w* \w dyed|strong="H5785"\w* red, \w and|strong="H6213"\w* \w over|strong="H4605"\w* \w that|strong="H6213"\w* \w a|strong="H3068"\w* \w covering|strong="H4372"\w* \w of|strong="H4372"\w* \w fine|strong="H8476"\w* \w leather|strong="H5785"\w*.\f + \fr 36:19 \ft Possibly the hides of large aquatic mammals\f* The Frames and Bases (Exodus 26:15–30)

Next, \w he|strong="H6213"\w* \w constructed|strong="H6213"\w* \w upright|strong="H5975"\w* \w frames|strong="H7175"\w* \w of|strong="H6086"\w* \w acacia|strong="H7848"\w* \w wood|strong="H6086"\w* \w for|strong="H6213"\w* \w the|strong="H6213"\w* \w tabernacle|strong="H4908"\w*.

\w Two|strong="H8147"\w* \w tenons|strong="H3027"\w* \f + \fr 36:22 \ft That is, projecting pieces of wood made for insertion into another piece; similarly in verse 24.\f* \w were|strong="H3027"\w* connected \w to|strong="H6213"\w* \w each|strong="H3605"\w* \w other|strong="H8147"\w* \w for|strong="H6213"\w* \w each|strong="H3605"\w* \w frame|strong="H7175"\w*. \w He|strong="H3651"\w* \w made|strong="H6213"\w* \w all|strong="H3605"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w frames|strong="H7175"\w* \w of|strong="H3027"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w tabernacle|strong="H4908"\w* \w in|strong="H6213"\w* \w this|strong="H3651"\w* \w way|strong="H3651"\w*.
